content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a case involving the dissolution of coownership of a property the plaintiff and defendant were former spouses who owned the property together the plaintiff initiated a procedure to dissolve the coownership but the defendant contested the plaintiffs share the case was referred to the municipal court which decided to dissolve the coownership and proceed with a public auction to sell the property the plaintiff then filed a lawsuit to establish ownership rights and requested a judgment the court examined the case documents heard witnesses and conducted inspections and expert examinations the final resolution is still pending the court determined that the property is marital property and should be divided equally between the parties unless agreed otherwise the court also found that the construction of the house on the property was funded by the marital community and therefore constitutes marital property the court determined that a civil partition specifically a sale via auction is the appropriate method of partition
